alert.note: Alert for GUC110 (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 1:02PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CHST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Saipan. * WHEN...Until 300 PM ChST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 102 PM ChST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.6 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.6 to 1.6 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Garapan, Dandan, China Town, Tanapag, As Mahetog, Koblerville, Chalan Kanoa I, Chalan Kanoa II, Chalan Kanoa III, San Roque, Kagman, Chalan Kanoa IV, Kagman III, Gualo Rai, Afetnas, Chalan Piao, Fananganan, Chalan Laulau, Chalan Kiya and San Jose (Oleai). - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
